title: AI Chugs a Bottle of Water Every Time You Chat With It
description: Artificial intelligence systems are thirsty, consuming as much as 500 milliliters of water – a single-serving water bottle – for each short conversation a user has with the GPT-3 version of OpenAI's ChatGPT system.
content: Artificial intelligence systems are thirsty, consuming as much as 500 milliliters of water – a single-serving water bottle – for each short conversation a user has with the GPT-3 version of OpenAI's ChatGPT system. They use roughly the same amount of... [7757 chars]

title: US manufacturing mired in weakness; AI spending boom helps some factories
description: U.S. manufacturing contracted for the sixth consecutive month in August, impacted by import tariffs, according to the Institute for Supply Management. However, increased spending on artificial intelligence is providing some support to specific industry segments. While new orders increased, production declined, and factory employment remained subdued, with suppliers experiencing slower delivery times and elevated input prices.

title: AI tech 'revolutionizing' stroke treatment in England
description: An artificial intelligence tool which quickly analyzes brain scans of stroke patients has helped boost chances of full recovery since being launched across England, the public health service said on Tuesday.

title: Quebec institute Mila names scientific director
description:

Hugo Larochelle. He is the former head of Google’s AI research lab in Montreal.

title: US manufacturing mired in weakness; AI spending boom helps some factories
description: U.S. manufacturing contracted for a sixth straight month in August as factories continued to grapple with the impact of import tariffs, but an artificial intelligence spending boom is lending support to some segments of the industry.

title: Quebec AI institute Mila names Hugo Larochelle as scientific director
description: Quebec artificial intelligence institute Mila has a new scientific director. Hugo Larochelle started in the job today. He is the former head of Google's AI research lab in Montreal and an adjunct professor at the Université de Montréal.
